member.name: T:System.Web.Optimization.AssetManager
member.summary: This class will eventually keeps a map of script and css references for the purposes of eliminating duplicate references and also handling rendering out bundle references correctly based on the EnableOptimizations flag

member.summary: Gets or registers the AssetManager for the HttpContext

member.summary: Given a list of asset paths, expands bundles into individual assets if optimizations are off Returns a deduplicated list of paths to render

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.AssetManager.ResolveVirtualPath(System.String)
member.summary: NOTE: Copied from WebPages.TagBuilder If the path is a valid URI we shouldn't try to resolve it. This is roughly the same logic as HREF. e.g. if the user puts www.foo.com/myScript.js then we should leave it that way. e.g. if the user puts ~/foo/myscripts.js we should resolve the ~/ to the correct location.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.AssetManager.AssetTag.Value
member.summary: This usually is the url to the script/style, but sometimes is the actual script, i.e. cdn fallback script

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.AssetManager.AssetTag.IsStaticAsset
member.summary: True for static assets, i.e. cdn fallback scripts

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.EnumerateFiles(System.Web.Optimization.BundleContext)
member.summary: Generates an enumeration of objects that represent the contents of the bundle.
member.param: The object that contains state for both the framework configuration and the HTTP request.
member.returns: An enumeration of objects that represent the contents of the bundle.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.ApplyTransforms(System.Web.Optimization.BundleContext,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Web.Optimization.BundleFile})
member.summary: Apply the set of objects to the bundle content.
member.param: The object that contains state for both the framework configuration and the HTTP request.
The compiled content of all files in the bundle.
The list of all file paths in the bundle.
member.returns: A object containing the processed bundle contents.
member.remarks: ApplyTransforms iterates through each object that was configured with the bundle when it was created and calls the transform's method.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.GenerateBundleResponse(System.Web.Optimization.BundleContext)
member.summary: Processes the bundle request to generate the response.
member.param: The object that contains state for both the framework configuration and the HTTP request.
member.returns: A object containing the processed bundle contents.
member.remarks: Generating the bundle response is accomplished based on the following steps: 1. Enumerates the contents of the bundle. 2. Filters the files using the IgnoreList 3. Orders the files. 4. Chooses any replacements using the FileExtensionReplacementList. 5. Builds the bundle content using the Builder. 6. Transforms the bundle using the Transform.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.Include(System.String[])
member.summary: Specifies a set of files to be included in the .
member.param: The virtual path of the file or file pattern to be included in the bundle.
member.returns: The object itself for use in subsequent method chaining.
member.remarks:
By default, files are included based on the order in which they are specified in the parameter. This behavior can be overridden by using the collection, or by creating a custom object.
Include also provides limited support for wildcards and substitution tokens in the last path segment. For example: A prefix wildcard: *js - or - A suffix wildcard: jquery* - or - The version substitution token: jquery-{version}.js

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.Include(System.String,System.Web.Optimization.IItemTransform[])
member.summary: Includes the specified pattern in the with transforms that apply only to this pattern.
member.param: The virtual path of the file or file pattern to be included in the bundle.
The transforms to apply only to the included items
member.returns: The object itself for use in subsequent method chaining.
member.remarks: Include also provides limited support for wildcards and substitution tokens in the last path segment. For example: A prefix wildcard: *js - or - A suffix wildcard: jquery* - or - The version substitution token: jquery-{version}.js

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.IncludeDirectory(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Includes all files in a directory that match a search pattern.
member.param: The virtual path to the directory from which to search for files.
The search pattern to use in selecting files to add to the bundle.
member.returns: The object itself for use in subsequent method chaining.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.IncludeDirectory(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Includes all files in a directory that match a search pattern.
member.param: The virtual path to the directory from which to search for files.
The search pattern to use in selecting files to add to the bundle.
Specifies whether to recursively search subdirectories of .
member.returns: The object itself for use in subsequent method chaining.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.GetInstrumentationMode(System.Web.HttpContextBase)
member.summary: Intrumentation mode applies only for Page Inspector and will consist of no minification and a special preamble between files in the bundle.
member.param: The HTTP context providing details of the request
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the requestor is Page Inspector.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.ProcessRequest(System.Web.Optimization.BundleContext)
member.summary: Logic for a bundle request is as follows: 1. Generate the ordered list of files to include in the bundle i.e. Orderer.OrderFiles(GetFiles()) 2. We read in the contents of the files, generate the BundleResponse, and apply the Transform specified 4. We send the response using the transformed BundleResponse

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.GetBundleResponse(System.Web.Optimization.BundleContext)
member.summary: Uses the cached response or generate the response, internal for BundleResolver to use

member.summary: Returns the full url with content hash if requested for the bundle

member.summary: Gets or sets an alternate url for the bundle when it is stored in a content delivery network.
member.remarks: In order to configure the Web optimization framework to emit links to the a bundle's CDN url, the value must not be null and must equal true.

member.remarks: By default, the Web optimization framework includes implementations for minifying scripts and styles.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.Builder
member.summary: Builds the bundle content from the individual files included in the object.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.EnableFileExtensionReplacements
member.summary: Specifies whether to use the

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.ConcatenationToken
member.summary: The token inserted between bundled files to ensure that the final bundle content is valid
member.remarks: By default, if is not specified, the Web optimization framework inserts a new line.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.Bundle.CacheKeys
member.summary: Internal for the default HttpContextCache, consider, make this public when we allow custom caches

member.name: T:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection
member.summary: The main entry point for Web optimization bundling and is exposed to developers via .

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: The constructor populates , , , and with default values. These values can be all removed with .

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.Add(System.Web.Optimization.Bundle)
member.summary: Adds a bundle to the collection
member.param: The bundle to add to the collection

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.AddDefaultIgnorePatterns(System.Web.Optimization.IgnoreList)
member.summary: Add default ignore patterns for common conventions.
member.param: The to populate with default values.
member.remarks:
The default ignore patterns added are as follows. Note that file matching these patterns will always be excluded from a bundle, enven if explicitly included. To exclude matching files from a bundle only in cases where they are added via a wildcard or substitution token, see . These values can be all removed with IgnoreList.Clear or .
*.intellisense.js
*-vsdoc.js
*.debug.js
*.min.js
*.min.css
*.map

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.AddDefaultFileOrderings(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Web.Optimization.BundleFileSetOrdering})
member.summary: Add default file ordering for common popuular script and style libraries.
member.param: A collection of objects to populate with default values.
member.remarks:
The purpose for applying these default file ordering values is to ensure that common libraries such as jquery are always located at or close to the top within a bundle. These values can be all removed with .
The default ordering values are as follows:
reset.css
normalize.css
jquery.js
jquery-min.js
jquery-*
jquery-ui*
jquery.ui*
jquery.unobtrusive*
jquery.validate*
modernizr-*
dojo.*
mootools-core*
mootools-*
prototype.js
prototype-*
scriptaculous-*
ext.js
ext-*

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.AddDefaultFileExtensionReplacements(System.Web.Optimization.FileExtensionReplacementList)
member.summary: Add default file extension replacements for common conventions.
member.param: The to populate with default values.
member.remarks:
The default conventions supported are the following:
select *.min.js when is true
select *.debug.js when is false

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.ResolveBundleUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves a bundle to a url based on the bundle's virtual path.
member.param: The virtual path for the bundle.
member.returns: The bundle url or null if the bundle cannot be found.
member.remarks: This overload will return a query parameter with a version stamp in the returned bundle url. To control whether the url includes a version stamp, use the overload.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.ResolveBundleUrl(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resolves a bundle to a url based on the bundle's virtual path.
member.param: The virtual path for the bundle.
Include a version stamp in the generated url.
member.returns: The bundle url or null if the bundle cannot be found.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.GetBundleFor(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the bundle for a virtual path.
member.param: The virutal path for the bundle.
member.returns: The object for the virtual path or null if no bundle exists at the path.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.Clear
member.summary: Removes all the bundles from the collection.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.ResetAll
member.summary: Removes all the bundles from the collection and removes support for common conventions.
member.remarks: In addition to calling on the collection, suport for common conventions is removed by also clearing , , , and

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.Remove(System.Web.Optimization.Bundle)
member.summary: Removes a single bundle from the collection.
member.param: The bundle to remove from the collection.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the bundle was succesfully removed from the collection.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.GetRegisteredBundles
member.summary: Gets all registered bundles
member.returns: A read-only collection of all objects in the collection.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets an enumerator for all bundles in the collection.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.FileSetOrderList
member.summary: Used to control the sorting of files within a bundle.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.IgnoreList
member.summary: Gets a list of file patterns which are always ignored by a bundle.
member.remarks: Files that match a pattern specified by in will be ignored even in the case where they are specifically included in the bundle definition. To specify ignore patterns that will by applied only to files included using a wildcard or substitution token, use the ignore list.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.DirectoryFilter
member.summary: Gets a list of file patterns which are ignored when including files using wildcards or substitution tokens.
member.remarks: This ignore list applies only when using a wildcard character (*) or substitution token as a part of including files in a bundle using . or .

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.FileExtensionReplacementList
member.summary: Enables selecting different permutations of files for different values.
member.remarks:
The common use case for file extnsion replacement lists is when a script file has a more verbose file (debug.js) to be used during debugging and a pre-minified version to be used at runtime (min.js). File extension replacements enables a developer to add all of those files to a bundle with the correct file being selected at runtime.
Note that the rules can select files that are not explicitly included in the bundle. For example, based on the default file extension conventions, calling with “jquery.js” will automatically select jquery.min.js and jquery.debug.js for the respective if the files exist.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.UseCdn
member.summary: Specifies whether a link to a should attempt to use

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of objects in the collection.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.BundleResponse.GetContentHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hashcode of the bundle contents, for purposes of generating a 'versioned' url for cache busting purposes. This is not used for cryptographic purposes, just as a quick and dirty way to give browsers a different url when the bundle changes

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.BundleResponse.Files
member.summary: The list of files that were used to generate the bundle.
member.remarks: The list of files is preserved in so that objects can be setup to monitor changes to the underlying files and rebuild the bundle when any of those contents change.

member.name: T:System.Web.Optimization.Styles
member.summary: Helper class for rendering link elements.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Styles.Render(System.String[])
member.summary: Renders link tags for a set of paths.
member.param: Set of virtual paths for which to generate link tags.
member.returns: HTML string containing the link tag or tags for the bundle.
member.remarks: Render generates multiple link tags for each item in the bundle when is set to false. When optimizations are enabled, Render generates a single link tag to a version-stamped URL which represents the entire bundle.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Styles.RenderFormat(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Renders link tags for a set of paths based on a format string.
member.param: Format string for defining the rendered link tags. For more details on format strings, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/txafckwd.aspx
Set of virtual paths for which to generate link tags.
member.returns: HTML string containing the link tag or tags for the bundle.
member.remarks: RenderFormat generates link tags for the supplied paths using the specified format string. It generates multiple link tags for each item in the bundle when is set to false. When optimizations are enabled, it generates a single link tag to a version-stamped URL which represents the entire bundle.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Styles.Url(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a version-stamped url for a bundle
member.remarks: If the supplied virtual path identifies a bundle, a version-stamped url is returned. If the virutal path is not a bundle, the resolved virutal path url is returned.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.Styles.Context
member.summary: Hook to pass mocked context for unit testing.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.Styles.DefaultTagFormat
member.summary: Default format string for defining how link tags are rendered.

member.summary: Renders script tags for a set of paths.
member.param: Set of virtual paths for which to generate script tags.
member.returns: HTML string containing the script tag or tags for the bundle.
member.remarks: Render generates multiple script tags for each item in the bundle when is set to false. When optimizations are enabled, Render generates a single script tag to a version-stamped URL which represents the entire bundle.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Scripts.RenderFormat(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Renders script tags for a set of paths based on a format string.
member.param: Format string for defining the rendered script tags. For more details on format strings, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/txafckwd.aspx
Set of virtual paths for which to generate script tags.
member.returns: HTML string containing the script tag or tags for the bundle.
member.remarks: RenderFormat generates script tags for the supplied paths using the specified format string. It generates multiple script tags for each item in the bundle when is set to false. When optimizations are enabled, it generates a single script tag to a version-stamped URL which represents the entire bundle.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.Scripts.Url(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a version-stamped url for a bundle
member.remarks: If the supplied virtual path identifies a bundle, a version-stamped url is returned. If the virutal path is not a bundle, the resolved virutal path url is returned.

member.name: T:System.Web.Optimization.DynamicFolderBundle
member.summary: Appends virtual urls to directories which bundle files in that directory.
member.remarks: As an example, for a subdirectory /Scripts that contains many js files, the declaration DynamicFolderBundle("js", "*.js") would cause all JavaScript files in the /Scripts directory to be bundled together and accessed by the virtual path ~/Scripts/js.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.DynamicFolderBundle.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The suffix appended to the directory name in the virtual path.
The pattern used for including files in the bundle.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The suffix appended to the directory name in the virtual path.
The pattern used for including files in the bundle.
A list of objects which process the contents of the bundle in the order which they are added.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.DynamicFolderBundle.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The suffix appended to the directory name in the virtual path.
The pattern used for including files in the bundle.
Specifies whether to recursively search subdirectories of referenced virtual directory.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The pattern used for including files in the bundle.
Specifies whether to recursively search subdirectories of referenced virtual directory.

member.name: M:System.Web.Optimization.DynamicFolderBundle.EnumerateFiles(System.Web.Optimization.BundleContext)
member.summary: Generates an enumeration of objects that represent the contents of the bundle.
member.param: The object that contains state for both the framework configuration and the HTTP request.
member.returns: An enumeration of objects that represent the contents of the bundle.
member.remarks: This will return all of the base method's files, and also add any dynamic files found in the requested directory at the end.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.DynamicFolderBundle.SearchPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the serach pattern which determines the files included in the bundle.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.DynamicFolderBundle.CdnPath
member.summary: Gets or sets an alternate url for the bundle when it is stored in a content delivery network.
member.remarks: Because a content delivery network is used with static resources, it does not make sense to ever use CdnPath with dynamic folder bundles.

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.DynamicFolderBundle.SearchSubdirectories
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the search pattern is applied to subdirectories.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to File does not exist..

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.Resources.OptimizationResources.InvalidPattern

member.name: P:System.Web.Optimization.Resources.OptimizationResources.MinifyError
